definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: Young Hercules Watch online for free.
sentences.chinese: 年輕的大力士在線觀看免費。

sentences.english: He is a man of great might.
sentences.chinese: 他是具有超凡力氣的大力士。

sentences.english: The current worlds strongest man is Mariusz Pudzianowski from Poland.
sentences.chinese: 目前世界大力士冠軍是來自於波蘭的馬瑞斯。

sentences.english: He is a Hercules in strength.
sentences.chinese: 他是個赫拉克勒斯式的大力士。

sentences.english: Ken: Here come the Herculeses. Zhan appears to lag behind.
sentences.chinese: “大力士”們都出來了，好像佔旭剛的排位比較落後。

sentences.english: Strong men compete in Finland’s wife-carrying world championship.
sentences.chinese: 大力士角逐芬蘭的背老婆世界錦標賽冠軍。

sentences.english: The bos'n's mate was a heavy man, bald, with a scarred and brutal face.
sentences.chinese: 這個水手長助手是個禿頂，面帶傷疤和兇相的大力士。

sentences.english: Sam is noted for his strength.
sentences.chinese: 薩姆是個著名的大力士。

sentences.english: Time's crutch effects more than the iron club of Hercules.
sentences.chinese: 時光的柺杖比大力士赫克琉斯的鐵棒還要管用。

sentences.english: Han Jia, do I look like a giant of the Tang Dynasty?
sentences.chinese: 韓佳，你看，我像不像唐朝的大力士？

sentences.english: Hercules, once journeying along a narrow roadway, came across a strange-looking animal.
sentences.chinese: 大力士，曾在一條小道上遇到一隻長相奇特的動物。

definition: extraordinary strength/super strong/strong as an ox
mace (weapon)/see 銅錘花臉|铜锤花脸[tong2 chui2 hua1 lian3]
